metadata.name: Language and Style (Epic Poem Expansion)
metadata.description: Language patterns and stylistic elements for epic poetry

invocation_patterns.text: Begin with a direct appeal to a muse or supernatural force for inspiration
Establish the central theme as a question posed to higher powers
Open with a statement of the work's grand purpose and scope
Introduce the hero through their lineage and divine connections
Start in medias res with a pivotal moment, then circle back to origins

epic_similes.text: Compare character actions to natural phenomena spanning multiple lines
Describe emotional states through extended comparisons to seasonal changes
Liken battle scenes to cosmic events with elaborate detail
Draw parallels between human endeavors and animal behaviors in detailed passages
Connect character transformations to mythological metamorphoses

epithets_and_naming.text: Assign recurring descriptive phrases to major characters (e.g., 'swift-footed')
Create compound adjectives that capture essential character traits
Use patronymics and matronymics to emphasize heritage and destiny
Refer to characters by their defining achievements rather than names
Employ place-based identifiers that connect characters to their lands

divine_machinery.text: Include supernatural interventions that alter the course of events
Depict divine councils where immortals debate the fate of mortals
Show gods taking disguises to interact directly with human characters
Present omens and prophecies that foreshadow key developments
Create divine conflicts that mirror and influence human struggles

formal_speech.text: Craft lengthy, formal speeches before battles or important decisions
Include ritualized exchanges between adversaries before conflict
Compose funeral orations that reflect on mortality and legacy
Write formal supplications to higher powers in moments of crisis
Create wisdom speeches from elder characters that reveal cultural values

metrical_patterns.text: Maintain consistent metrical structure with occasional variations for emphasis
Use caesuras (mid-line pauses) to create dramatic tension
Employ enjambment to carry thought across line boundaries for flowing narrative
Create sonic patterns through alliteration in moments of high emotion
Vary rhythm to match actionâ€”swift for battles, measured for ceremonies

catalog_technique.text: Include detailed lists of participants in major events
Enumerate possessions or treasures with their histories and significance
Catalog genealogies that connect characters to mythic ancestors
Detail geographic features of the setting with cultural associations
List sequential events or prophecies in formal, parallel structures
